Key Match Events: Seth Lugo threw seven solid innings, allowing one run on six hits with nine strikeouts.
The Royals were no-hit into the eighth inning.
James McArthur allowed a walk-off double to Jose Altuve in Kansas City’s 3-2 loss.
Framber Valdez threw seven no-hit innings for the Astros.
Kyle Isbel broke up the possible combined no-hitter with a single in the eighth inning.
Paul DeJong hit a two-run homer to tie the game in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro praised Seth Lugo's performance, calling it exceptional.
Seth Lugo credited his preparation between starts for his performance.
Paul DeJong reflected on his game-tying home run and the impact of losing Vinnie Pasquantino to injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Despite the loss, the Royals showed resolve and nearly stole the game from the Astros.
First baseman Vinnie Pasquantino was announced to be out six to eight weeks with a broken thumb.
